title: 2020 Jordan Peterson / IDW Christian Commentary with Dr. Esther O'Reilly
description:
Esther has long been a conversation partner in the Jordan Peterson, IDW Christian conversation. End of the year is a good time to check in and compare notes.

Links
You can find her on Twitter @EstherOfReilly
Even Atheists Dream Christian Dreams https://t.co/CzIlapYz3N?amp=1
Douglas Murray Christian Atheist https://t.co/IeMZcvCLWg?amp=1
Nigerian Christians https://t.co/HplAm49uzh?amp=1
Douglas Murray and the Closing of his Old Church  https://t.co/GdGMr28IuZ?amp=1

Show Notes

Some of his best stuff is like buried treasure

Strange Death of Europe

Older form of Humanism, Humane view of mankind and history. 

Written quite a bit about Euthanasia and suicide, assisted suicide, "life" issues

Old Roman perspective, better to choose the time of your death. 

There could be meaning in that. Last moments of his life he discovers everything

I don't think our bodies are necessarily our own. 

Fascinated by figures who are haunted by faith in Christianity. This sad deconstruction story, having grown up in the church, but he keeps wandering back, going to Nigeria, people who are living out their faith. 

Douglas is attracted to that. He's longing for that but he's trapped in this arid, post-Christian UK in the West. 

Douglas Murray and Tom Holland convo would go? 

Justin Brierley always pops the question

Tom needs a good marriage counselor between two parts of himself

Tom Holland on RE-enchantment

St. Margrets , 

David Nasser 

Rod Dreher

Deconstruction and intentionality

Performity with queerness

Fiddler on the roof: if God lived on earth people would break his windows

Story is a sense-making mechanism, suffering, evil, 

They fall short until they're connected to story

You can set good arguments but you also have to set a better story against it. 

All true stories must reconcile
